{
    "number": 192592,
    "data": "1,5,13,17,29,37,41,53,61,73,89,97,109,113,137,149,157,173,181,193,197,229,233,241,257,269,277,281,293,313,317,337,349,353,373,389,397,401,409,421,433,449,457,461,509,521,541,557,569,577,593,601,613,617",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and 3x+2y is a prime, then 3x+2y is in S, and 1 is in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192476 and A192580."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A192592/b192592.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..609</a>"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {1}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 10000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, 2 x + 3 y], 2 x + 3 y]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1,",
        "         Length[w]}]]]], # < 1000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]     (* A192592 *)",
        "PrimePi[t]    (* A192593 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580, A192593."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2011",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 8,
    "time": "2017-05-08T09:22:52-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-06T13:15:39-04:00"
}
